data.title: Island of Mozambique
data.text: The Island of Mozambique lies off northern Mozambique between the Mozambique Channel and Mossuril Bay and is part of Nampula Province Prior to 1898 it was the capital of colonial Portuguese East Africa With its rich history and sandy beaches the Island of Mozambique is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of Mozambique s fastest growing tourist destinations It has a permanent population of approximately 14 000 people and is served by nearby Lumbo Airport on the Nampula mainland The name of the country Mozambique is derived from the name of this island
